name: G. Tree Destruction
input: InputThe first line of the input contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases.The first line of each test case contains one integer $$$n$$$ ($$$2 \le n \le 2 \cdot 10^5$$$) — the size of the tree.The next $$$n-1$$$ lines contain two integers $$$u$$$ and $$$v$$$ ($$$1 \le u, v \le n$$$, $$$u \ne v$$$) — the vertices connected by an edge. It is guaranteed that the edges form a tree.It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ across all test cases does not exceed $$$2 \cdot 10^5$$$.
output: OutputFor each test case, output one integer — the maximum number of connected components that can be achieved using the described operation.
